alert.note: Alert for Knox; Morrow (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:48PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Morrow and Knox Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 348 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Centerburg, or 13 miles southwest of Mount Vernon, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Vernon, Fredericktown, Gambier, Centerburg, Danville, Sparta, Martinsburg, Gann and Bladensburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for north central and northeastern Ohio.
